00013 #include <vector>
00014 #include <GeographicLib/Constants.hpp>
00015 #include <GeographicLib/SphericalEngine.hpp>

00022 
00023 namespace GeographicLib {
00024 
00025   /**
00026    * \brief Spherical Harmonic sums for a circle.
00027    *
00028    * The class is a companion to SphericalEngine.  If the results of a
00029    * spherical harmonic sum are needed for several points on a circle of
00030    * constant latitude \e lat and height \e h, then SphericalEngine::Circle can
00031    * compute the inner sum, which is independent of longitude \e lon, and
00032    * produce a CircularEngine object.  CircularEngine::operator()() can
00033    * then be used to perform the outer sum for particular vales of \e lon.
00034    * This can lead to substantial improvements in computational speed for high
00035    * degree sum (approximately by a factor of \e N / 2 where \e N is the
00036    * maximum degree).
00037    *
00038    * CircularEngine is tightly linked to the internals of SphericalEngine.  For
00039    * that reason, the constructor for this class is private.  Use
00040    * SphericalHarmonic::Circle, SphericalHarmonic1::Circle, and
00041    * SphericalHarmonic2::Circle to create instances of this class.
00042    *
00043    * CircularEngine stores the coefficients needed to allow the summation over
00044    * order to be performed in 2 or 6 vectors of length \e M + 1 (depending on
00045    * whether gradients are to be calculated).  For this reason the constructor
00046    * may throw a bad_alloc exception.
00047    **********************************************************************/
00048 
00049   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT CircularEngine {
00050   private:
00051     typedef Math::real real;
00052     enum normalization {
00053       full = SphericalEngine::full,
00054       schmidt = SphericalEngine::schmidt,
00055     };
00056     int _M;
00057     bool _gradp;
00058     normalization _norm;
00059     real _scale, _a, _r, _u, _t;
00060     std::vector<real> _wc, _ws, _wrc, _wrs, _wtc, _wts;
00061     real _q, _uq, _uq2;
00062 
00063     Math::real Value(bool gradp, real cl, real sl,
00064                      real& gradx, real& grady, real& gradz) const throw();
00065 
00066     static inline void cossin(real x, real& cosx, real& sinx) {
00067       x = x >= 180 ? x - 360 : (x < -180 ? x + 360 : x);
00068       real xi = x * Math::degree<real>();
00069       cosx = std::abs(x) ==   90 ? 0 : cos(xi);
00070       sinx =          x  == -180 ? 0 : sin(xi);
00071     }
00072 
00073     friend class SphericalEngine;
00074     CircularEngine(int M, bool gradp, SphericalEngine::normalization norm,
00075                    real scale, real a, real r, real u, real t)
00076       : _M(M)
00077       , _gradp(gradp)
00078       , _norm(normalization(norm))
00079       , _scale(scale)
00080       , _a(a)
00081       , _r(r)
00082       , _u(u)
00083       , _t(t)
00084       , _wc(std::vector<real>(_M + 1, 0))
00085       , _ws(std::vector<real>(_M + 1, 0))
00086       , _wrc(std::vector<real>(_gradp ? _M + 1 : 0, 0))
00087       , _wrs(std::vector<real>(_gradp ? _M + 1 : 0, 0))
00088       , _wtc(std::vector<real>(_gradp ? _M + 1 : 0, 0))
00089       , _wts(std::vector<real>(_gradp ? _M + 1 : 0, 0))
00090       {
00091         _q = _a / _r;
00092         _uq = _u * _q;
00093         _uq2 = Math::sq(_uq);
00094       }
00095 
00096     void SetCoeff(int m, real wc, real ws)
00097     { _wc[m] = wc; _ws[m] = ws; }
00098 
00099     void SetCoeff(int m, real wc, real ws,
00100                   real wrc, real wrs, real wtc, real wts) {
00101       _wc[m] = wc; _ws[m] = ws;
00102       if (_gradp) {
00103         _wrc[m] = wrc; _wrs[m] = wrs;
00104         _wtc[m] = wtc; _wts[m] = wts;
00105       }
00106     }
00107 
00108   public:
00109     /**
00110      * Evaluate the sum for a particular longitude given in terms of its
00111      * cosine and sine.
00112      *
00113      * @param[in] coslon the cosine of the longitude.
00114      * @param[in] sinlon the sine of the longitude.
00115      * @return[in] \e V the value of the sum.
00116      *
00117      * The arguments must satisfy \e coslon<sup>2</sup> + \e sinlon<sup>2</sup>
00118      * = 1.
00119      **********************************************************************/
00120     Math::real operator()(real coslon, real sinlon) const throw() {
00121       real dummy;
00122       return Value(false, coslon, sinlon, dummy, dummy, dummy);
00123     }
00124 
00125     /**
00126      * Evaluate the sum for a particular longitude.
00127      *
00128      * @param[in] lon the longitude (degrees).
00129      * @return[in] \e V the value of the sum.
00130      **********************************************************************/
00131     Math::real operator()(real lon) const throw() {
00132       real coslon, sinlon;
00133       cossin(lon, coslon, sinlon);
00134       return (*this)(coslon, sinlon);
00135     }
00136 
00137     /**
00138      * Evaluate the sum and its gradient for a particular longitude given in
00139      * terms of its cosine and sine.
00140      *
00141      * @param[in] coslon the cosine of the longitude.
00142      * @param[in] sinlon the sine of the longitude.
00143      * @param[out] gradx \e x component of the gradient.
00144      * @param[out] grady \e y component of the gradient.
00145      * @param[out] gradz \e z component of the gradient.
00146      * @return[in] \e V the value of the sum.
00147      *
00148      * The gradients will only be computed if the CircularEngine object was
00149      * created with this capability (e.g., via \e gradp = true in
00150      * SphericalHarmonic::Circle).  If not, \e gradx, etc., will not be
00151      * touched.  The arguments must satisfy \e coslon<sup>2</sup> + \e
00152      * sinlon<sup>2</sup> = 1.
00153      **********************************************************************/
00154     Math::real operator()(real coslon, real sinlon,
00155                           real& gradx, real& grady, real& gradz) const throw() {
00156       return Value(true, coslon, sinlon, gradx, grady, gradz);
00157     }
00158 
00159     /**
00160      * Evaluate the sum and its gradient for a particular longitude.
00161      *
00162      * @param[in] lon the longitude (degrees).
00163      * @param[out] gradx \e x component of the gradient.
00164      * @param[out] grady \e y component of the gradient.
00165      * @param[out] gradz \e z component of the gradient.
00166      * @return[in] \e V the value of the sum.
00167      *
00168      * The gradients will only be computed if the CircularEngine object was
00169      * created with this capability (e.g., via \e gradp = true in
00170      * SphericalHarmonic::Circle).  If not, \e gradx, etc., will not be
00171      * touched.
00172      **********************************************************************/
00173     Math::real operator()(real lon,
00174                           real& gradx, real& grady, real& gradz) const throw() {
00175       real coslon, sinlon;
00176       cossin(lon, coslon, sinlon);
00177       return (*this)(coslon, sinlon, gradx, grady, gradz);
00178     }
00179   };
00180 
00181 } // namespace GeographicLib
